title: "What is the Buddhist concept of Karma and how does it relate to creative acts and collective consciousness?"
first_phrase: In the last 200 tokens, the text discusses the concept of Karma in Buddhism, which dictates that all beings are subject to the inescapable law created by the fruits of their actions. It also talks about how Christianity seeks universal unity as universal creation and, along with other religions, tries to coerce the masses' occult magic through external forms or cults. The text highlights how every human act is a transformation of form, and individual and collective acts create single and collective forms. The creators of religions were enlightened individuals who, through external forms and precepts, tried to control the occult magic of the masses.
content: Questa e' la prima chiave del Karma L'atto creativo e' cosciente o incosciente secondo che lo stato di mag nell'operatore dell'atto e' uno stato cosciente o incosciente. Lo stato di mag e' sempre esistente, sempre vero, sempre reale in tutti gli esseri vivi e pensanti. In alcuni e sono pochi, lo' stato di mag e' cosciente, intelligente, palese. In altri, e sono la grande massa umana, lo stato di mag e' occulto ignorato, incosciente. I fondatori|di religioni chi più' chi meno furono tutti degl'illuminati cioè' degli individui divinizzati per lo stato di mag cosciente e palpante. Costoro per mezzo di forme o culti esteriori, per precetti, per esempio, hanno' sempre tentato di coercire il mag occulto ed ignorato delle folle, tutta la folla dei pezzenti, degli addolorati, dei. passionati rappresenta una materia magica immensa a forza di entusiasmo, di fede o di paura in due barriere che la utilizzano, senza deviamento possibile per un fine comune.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the first key of Karma is consciousness. Every living and thinking being possesses a magical state that is either conscious or unconscious. The founders of religions were individuals who possessed consciousness and used it to attempt to control the unconscious magic of the masses. The universe is a continuous reproduction of itself through the different stages of thought and will. Good is the will that creates, and the form is the creation of the moment that carries within itself the potential for future creation. Understanding this Karma creative force can be powerful in helping you lead a more fulfilling life.
